By Gracie Daw

University Radio York played on 'Campus Hopper' Bus

University radio York is now being played on the free 'Campus Hopper' bus running between Heslington East and West campuses. The station went live on the Buses yesterday

NUS National Conference: live video

The NUS National Conference comes from Sheffield this year and you can watch the whole event live over the three days

YSTV clinch top honour

The National Student Television Awards at the weekend saw YSTV pick up the award of Best Broadcaster

Contractors for new YUSU Student Centre fall into administration

Building work on the new YUSU Student Centre is temporarily suspended after the Principal Contractor, Killby & Gayford, fell into administration last week (Thumbnail credit Photo credit: Andy Davis)

The Gallery nightclub's future is saved

A review of nightclub The Gallery's licence has been withdrawn following assurances by its owners to address alcohol-related problems in the club (Thumbnail credit Photo credit: Lucy Dixon)

Universities to set exams in planned A-level reform

Changes put forward by Michael Gove, the Education Secretary, in the way A Levels are set could see universities setting A-level exams (Thumbnail credit Photo credit: albertogp123)

Devolution for Yorkshire proposed

York's City Council leader, James Alexander, has proposed that Yorkshire should be given "Scottish-style devolution" because of its geographical size and large economy. This would be a regional assembly which would gain control of certain powers from the UK Government. (Thumbnail credit Photo credit: brianpettinger)

Tens of thousands spent honouring "worthy" figures

It has emerged that the University spends thousands of pounds on entertaining public figures and awarding them honorary degrees. Over the last four years, PS40,000 has been spent on associated costs (Thumbnail credit Photo credit: Georgi Mabee)

V-bar renovation under question again

By James Bithell

Commercial Services have released provisional plans for the refurbishment of V-Bar, however, they have stated that there is no confirmed date for the renovation (Thumbnail credit Commerical Services have released these provisional plans for V-bar)

Female professors continue to be marginalised

Female academics continue to be marginalised, demonstrated by recent figures which have revealed just 24 per cent of University of York professors are female, up only one per cent from 2010. (Thumbnail credit Hull University)

Non-academic staff at York outnumber academic employees by 25 per cent

The University has been revealed as employing significantly more non-academic staff than academic, and is above the national average. (Thumbnail credit ROBBOPHOTOS)

College drop-out rate highest in Alcuin

Alcuin College has seen almost double the drop-out rate of all other undergraduate colleges with the exception of James this year (Thumbnail credit B-Henry's is Alcuin's college bar and one of Alcuin students' social areas Photo credit: Philippa Grafton)

More students choose to study abroad as participation doubles

Students at York are increasingly attracted by foreign universities as the number of participants in the study abroad programme has doubled in the last three years (Thumbnail credit Erik Eckel)

Staff join calls for a Sustainability Officer

The University has been criticised for showing "a lot of talk but not enough action" on the issue of sustainability, from the Chair of the University's Sustainability Forum. (Thumbnail credit Photo credit: CARLOS62)

UCAS application alterations face opposition

UCAS has proposed changes to its application process that would be implemented in 2016

Missing teen still not found

The search continues for York teenager Jordan Sullivan, who was last seen almost a month ago

York Students lay out plans for NUS walkout

Students from the University of York, York St. John University, and York College will take to the streets on 14th March in protest against government changes to Higher Education

Derwent's 'Nicked' campaign causes controversy

A large number of Derwent students have reacted angrily after their College Welfare team launched its 'Nicked' campaign. (Thumbnail credit Agatha Torrance)

Election turnout breaks recent YUSU records

YUSU Elections' turnout hit 36.8 per cent, with 5,720 unique voters casting a total of 40,218 ballots, which based on last year's figures would place YUSU's election turnout as the third highest in the country (Thumbnail credit Agatha Torrance)

Society funding problems

YUSU has been accused of ignoring concerns raised by a society about allocating funding

Kellogg's congratulate 'Special K'

US universities: what can we learn?

By James Bithell

As higher fees hit UK universities, is there a danger of a US style system? Martin Spurr talks to Jane Grenville who recently went to visit the American high fees economy (Thumbnail credit In a system where students yield more power, will the student or academic experience be the most important? Photo credit: David Michael Morris)

York accepted into elite Russell Group of universities

The University has announced that it has been invited to join the Russell Group, an elite group of universities in the UK that consists of institutions such as Oxford and Cambridge (Thumbnail credit York was founded in 1963 but has since developed a worldwide reputation)

Kallum Taylor takes Presidential victory in hotly contested elections

In what has been a close contest over the last two weeks, Kallum Taylor emerged victorious in the battle for YUSU President, winning by 2129 votes to Zahra Latif's 1745 in the fourth round (Thumbnail credit Photo credit: Philippa Grafton)

Reaction to the election results

Listen to the reactions from some of the winning and losing candidates

Election exit poll predicts three way battle for President

Exit polls released for the YUSU elections have predicted Kallum Taylor to win by a margin of only one per cent.

High turnout seen in YUSU Elections

By James Bithell

Voter turnout for the 2012 YUSU Elections is expected to be one of the highest on record after reaching 27 per cent as of 12pm today with two and a half days of campaigning still remaining

Carney "expecting to be given campaigning ban"

Presidential candidate James Carney has declared that he is "expecting to be given a campaigning ban in the near future" following a breach of YUSU election rules (Thumbnail credit Goodricke College on Heslington East Photo credit: Philippa Grafton)

Philosophy Department issue incorrect marks

An administrative error by the Philosophy department led to some students receiving the wrong marks on eVision for exams sat in January (Thumbnail credit Photo credit: University of York)
